<DOCUMENT>
<TYPE>EX-10.7.8
<SEQUENCE>9
<FILENAME>a2129328zex-10_78.htm
<DESCRIPTION>EXHIBIT 10.7.8
<TEXT>
<HTML>
<HEAD>

</HEAD>
<BODY BGCOLOR="#FFFFFF" LINK=BLUE  VLINK=PURPLE>
<BR>
<FONT SIZE=3 ><A HREF="#04SEA1034_8">QuickLinks</A></FONT>
<font size=3> -- Click here to rapidly navigate through this document</font>
<!-- TOC_END -->
<P ALIGN="RIGHT"><FONT SIZE=2><A
NAME="kw1035_exhibit_10.7.8"> </A>
<A NAME="toc_kw1035_1"> </A>
<BR></FONT><FONT SIZE=2><B>Exhibit 10.7.8    <BR>    </B></FONT></P>

<P ALIGN="CENTER"><FONT SIZE=2><B>2003 PLAN AMENDMENTS<BR>
RETIREMENT SAVINGS AND INVESTMENT PLAN AND CASH<BR>
BALANCE PENSION PLAN  </B></FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2><I>AMENDMENT No.&nbsp;6 TO THE RETIREMENT SAVING AND INVESTMENT PLAN  </I></FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;I.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><I>In-Kind Distributions</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>. </FONT></P>

<UL>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Section&nbsp;8.2
is amended by replacing the first sentence in that section with </FONT></P>

<UL>
<UL>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>After
all required accounting adjustments, the Trustee, in accord with the direction of the Administration Committee, shall make payment of the Participant's Vested Accrued Benefit in cash or in kind
(but only to the extent his Accounts contain contributions that constitute contributions to the ESOP under Section&nbsp;4 of Appendix&nbsp;C to the Plan), or a combination thereof, under one of
the following methods, as elected by the Participant or Beneficiary: </FONT></P>

</UL>
</UL>
</UL>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;II.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><I>Participant Fees</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>. </FONT></P>

<UL>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Section&nbsp;17.3
is amended by adding the following to the end of Section&nbsp;17.3: </FONT></P>

<UL>
<UL>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>The
Administration Committee is authorized and directed to charge certain Plan expenses to certain Participants, to the extent permitted by law and related regulations. Specifically, the
Administration Committee is authorized and directed to charge a fee to each Participant who receives a distribution, a fee to any Participant who takes out a loan, and a fee to any Former Participant
who maintains an IDP account. The Administration Committee is authorized to pay these expenses from the Trust and allocate the expenses to relevant Participants' Accounts. The Administration Committee
shall determine the amount of the distribution fee and may adjust the fee from time to time, at its discretion, provided that the fee must be reasonable with respect to the services provided. </FONT></P>

</UL>
</UL>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Section&nbsp;6.2
is amended by adding the following to the end of Section&nbsp;6.2: </FONT></P>

<UL>
<UL>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>In
addition, each Participant's Account shall be charged with any expenses to the extent authorized under Section&nbsp;17.3. </FONT></P>

</UL>
</UL>
</UL>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;III.&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><I>Hardship Withdrawals</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>. </FONT></P>

<UL>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Section&nbsp;9.2
is replaced by the following: </FONT></P>

<UL>
<UL>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>9.2(a)
</FONT><FONT SIZE=2><I>General</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>. A Participant shall be entitled to make withdrawals form his Salary Deferral Account prior to termination of Service in the case of and
to the extent required by a hardship, subject to the limitations and conditions of this Section. A hardship exists if a withdrawal is necessary to satisfy an immediate and heavy financial need of the
Participant, and is in an amount necessary to satisfy the financial need. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>(1)&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Subject
to the limitations stated herein, any hardship withdrawal shall first be made pro-rata from the Participant's Account. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>(2)&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Hardship
withdrawals from a Participant's Salary Deferral Account are limited to the Participant's total Salary Deferral Contributions as of the date of the withdrawal, plus amounts
treated as such under Treas. Reg. &sect; 1.401(k)-1(b)(5) and earnings on all such amounts through December&nbsp;31, 1988 (or the market value of the Participant's Salary Deferral
Account, if less) less the amount of previous hardship withdrawals. These limitations also apply to amounts that are attributable to salary reduction contributions and qualified employer contributions
or qualified employer contributions made to another </FONT></P>

</UL>
</UL>
</UL>
<HR NOSHADE>
<!-- ZEQ.=1,SEQ=1,EFW="2129328",CP="WASHINGTON MUTUAL, INC",DN="8",CHK=142786,FOLIO='blank',FILE='DISK018:[04SEA5.04SEA1035]KW1035A.;9',USER='VDESIO',CD=';6-MAR-2004;22:16' -->
<A NAME="page_kw1035_1_2"> </A>
<UL>
<UL>
<UL>
<BR>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>plan
in which the Participant participated that are received by the Trust in a trust-to-trust transfer described in Section&nbsp;5.4(b). </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>(3)&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Notwithstanding
the foregoing, no hardship distribution will be allowed for a Participant whose eligible amount under subparagraph 1 is less then $500. </FONT></P>


<P><FONT SIZE=2>(4)&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Hardship
determinations shall be made according to the standards set forth below in subsections (b)&nbsp;and (c). These standards shall be modified in accordance with revenue
rulings, notices, and other documents of general applicability published by the Internal Revenue service to expand the list of deemed immediate and heavy financial needs and additional methods for
distributions to be deemed necessary to satisfy an immediate and heavy financial need. </FONT></P>

</UL>
</UL>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(b)&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><I>Immediate and Heavy Financial Need.</I></FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The
Participant will be deemed to have an immediate and heavy financial need if and only if the Participant requests a distribution for one of the following reasons: </FONT></P>

<UL>
<UL>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>(1)&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Expenses
for medical care described in section&nbsp;213(d) previously incurred by the Participant, the Participant's spouse, or any dependents of the Participant (as defined in
section&nbsp;152) or necessary for these persons to obtain medical care described in section&nbsp;213(d); </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>(2)&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Costs
directly related to the purchase of a principal residence for the Participant (excluding mortgage payments); </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>(3)&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Payment
of tuition, related educational fees, and room and board expenses, for the next 12&nbsp;months of post-secondary education for the Participant, or the
Participant's spouse, children, or dependents (as defined in section&nbsp;152); or </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>(4)&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Payments
necessary to prevent the eviction of the Participant from the Participant's principal residence or foreclosure on the mortgage on that residence. </FONT></P>

</UL>
</UL>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(c)&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><I>Withdrawal Necessary to Satisfy Financial Need.</I></FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;A
withdrawal will be deemed necessary to satisfy an immediate and heavy financial need of Participant if and only if the Participant certifies and agrees that all of the following
requirements are satisfied: </FONT></P>

<UL>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(1)&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The
distribution is not in excess of the amount of the immediate and heavy financial need of the Participant. The amount of an immediate and heavy financial need may
include any amounts necessary to pay any federal, state, or local income taxes or penalties reasonably anticipated to result from the distribution; </FONT></P>


<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(2)&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The
Participant has obtained all distributions, other than hardship distributions, and all nontaxable (at the time of the loan) loans currently available under all plans
maintained by the employer; </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(3)&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The
Participant will not make elective contributions and employee contributions to the plan and all other plans maintained by the Company for at least 12&nbsp;months
after receipt of the hardship distribution. For this purpose the phrase "all other plans maintained by the Company means all qualified and non qualified plans of deferred compensation maintained by
the Company, including without limitation, stock option, stock purchase, or similar plans. </FONT></P>

</UL>
<DL compact>
<DT style='margin-bottom:-11pt;'><FONT SIZE=2>(c)</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2><I>Suspension of Salary Deferral Contributions</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>. Effective for Hardship Withdrawals effected on or after October&nbsp;1, 2003, a
Participant who receives a Hardship Withdrawal is prohibited from making Salary Deferral Contributions for six (6)&nbsp;months. </FONT></DD></DL>
</UL>
<P ALIGN="CENTER"><FONT SIZE=2>2</FONT></P>

<HR NOSHADE>
<!-- ZEQ.=2,SEQ=2,EFW="2129328",CP="WASHINGTON MUTUAL, INC",DN="8",CHK=644521,FOLIO='2',FILE='DISK018:[04SEA5.04SEA1035]KW1035A.;9',USER='VDESIO',CD=';6-MAR-2004;22:16' -->
<A NAME="page_kw1035_1_3"> </A>
<UL>
<UL>
</UL>
<DL compact>
<DT style='margin-bottom:-11pt;'><FONT SIZE=2>(d)</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2><I>No Redeposit of Hardship Withdrawal</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>. A Participant shall not be permitted to recontribute to or redeposit in his Accounts any portion
of the amounts withdrawn by reason of hardship.
<BR><BR></FONT></DD><DT style='margin-bottom:-11pt;'><FONT SIZE=2>(e)</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2><I>Hardship Withdrawal Ineligible for Rollover</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>. The portion of a Hardship Withdrawal distributed after December&nbsp;31, 1998
attributable to elective deferral contribution may not be part of an eligible rollover distribution. </FONT></DD></DL>
</UL>
<BR>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;IV.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><I>Name Change</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Effective
January&nbsp;1, 2004, the official Plan name shall be the "WaMu Savings Plan." Accordingly, each reference in the Plan document to the Washington Mutual,&nbsp;Inc.
Retirement Savings and Investment Plan or the Retirement Savings and Investment Plan shall thereafter refer to the "WaMu Savings Plan." </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;V.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><I>In Service Distribution of Rollover Contributions</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Effective
October&nbsp;1, 2003, the following new Section&nbsp;8.1(e) is hereby added: </FONT></P>

<UL>
<UL>
<UL>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>(e)&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><I>In-Service Distribution.</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2> Notwithstanding any contrary provisions in the Plan, effective October&nbsp;1, 2003, a
Participant may elect to receive all or any portion of his account to the extent of any Rollover Contributions and any earnings thereon. </FONT></P>

</UL>
</UL>
</UL>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;VI.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><I>No In-Kind Rollover Contributions.</I></FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Effective
November, 1, 2003, new Section&nbsp;5.4(c) is added as follows: </FONT></P>

<UL>
<UL>
<UL>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>(c)&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Notwithstanding
the foregoing, effective November&nbsp;1, 2003, Rollover Contributions must be made exclusively in cash. </FONT></P>

</UL>
</UL>
</UL>
<P ALIGN="CENTER"><FONT SIZE=2><B>APPENDIX D  </B></FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;1.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><I>Definitions.</I></FONT></P>


<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Capitalized
terms in this Appendix&nbsp;D are defined in Article&nbsp;2 of the Washington Mutual,&nbsp;Inc. Retirement Savings and Investment
Plan</FONT><FONT SIZE=2><B>,</B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2> with the following exceptions: </FONT></P>

<UL>
<UL>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>1.1.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><I>Pioneer</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>. Pioneer Savings Bank. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>1.2.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><I>Pioneer ESOP</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>. Pioneer Savings Bank Employee Stock Ownership Plan as amended and restated, generally effective as of January&nbsp;1,
1998. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>1.3.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><I>Pioneer ESOP Accrued Benefit</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>. The benefit accrued under the Pioneer ESOP as of September&nbsp;30, 2003. </FONT></P>


<P><FONT SIZE=2>1.4.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><I>Prior Pioneer Participant</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>. Any person who is entitled to a benefit under the Pioneer ESOP that has not been distributed in full as of
September&nbsp;30, 2003. </FONT></P>

</UL>
</UL>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;2.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><I>Background.</I></FONT></P>

<UL>
<UL>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>2.1.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The
Company acquired Pioneer and Pioneer merged into the Company as of March&nbsp;1, 1993. As a result, the Company became the successor sponsor of the Pioneer ESOP. </FONT></P>


<P><FONT SIZE=2>2.2.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The
Company has continued to maintain the Pioneer ESOP but has made no contributions to the Pioneer ESOP. Prior Pioneer Participants continued to accrue vesting service under the
Pioneer ESOP for their service with the Company. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>2.3.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The
Company amended the Plan effective April&nbsp;1, 2002 to convert part of the Plan to an Employee Stock Ownership Plan under Section&nbsp;407(d)(6) of ERISA and
section&nbsp;4975(e)(7) of the Code. </FONT></P>

</UL>
</UL>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;3.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><I>Applicability.</I></FONT></P>

<P ALIGN="CENTER"><FONT SIZE=2>3</FONT></P>

<HR NOSHADE>
<!-- ZEQ.=3,SEQ=3,EFW="2129328",CP="WASHINGTON MUTUAL, INC",DN="8",CHK=924161,FOLIO='3',FILE='DISK018:[04SEA5.04SEA1035]KW1035A.;9',USER='VDESIO',CD=';6-MAR-2004;22:16' -->
<A NAME="page_kw1035_1_4"> </A>
<UL>
<UL>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>3.1.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Notwithstanding
any other provisions of the Plan to the contrary, the provisions of this Appendix&nbsp;D shall apply to each Prior Pioneer Participant who became a participant in
the Plan. </FONT></P>

</UL>
</UL>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;4.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><I>Participation</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>. </FONT></P>

<UL>
<UL>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>4.1.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Effective
October&nbsp;1, 2003, each Prior Pioneer Participant shall become a Former Participant under Section&nbsp;2.30 of the Plan only with respect to their Pioneer ESOP
Accrued Benefit. </FONT></P>

</UL>
</UL>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;5.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><I>Accrued Benefit.</I></FONT></P>

<UL>
<UL>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>5.1.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;As
of October&nbsp;1, 2003, the Accrued Benefit of each Prior Pioneer Participant shall be credited with an amount equal to his Pioneer ESOP Accrued Benefit as of
September&nbsp;30, 2003. Amounts credited to Participant Accounts shall constitute contributions to the Employee Stock Purchase Program ("ESOP") under Section&nbsp;4 of Appendix&nbsp;C, and
shall remain part of the ESOP until the Participants elect to transfer the funds to a fund other than the Company Stock Fund. </FONT></P>

</UL>
</UL>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;6.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><I>Vesting of Pioneer ESOP Accrued Benefit.</I></FONT></P>

<UL>
<UL>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>6.1.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Each
Participant who was a Prior Pioneer Participant who becomes a participant in the Plan effective October&nbsp;1, 2003 shall become fully vested in his Pioneer ESOP Accrued
Benefit. </FONT></P>

</UL>
</UL>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;7.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><I>Protection of Benefits.</I></FONT></P>

<UL>
<UL>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>7.1.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Notwithstanding
the foregoing, nothing in this Appendix&nbsp;D shall be construed as reducing benefits of Prior Pioneer Participants in violation of section&nbsp;411(d)(6) of the
Code. </FONT></P>

</UL>
</UL>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;8.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><I>Applicability of Plan Provisions.</I></FONT></P>

<UL>
<UL>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>8.1.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Except
as otherwise specifically provided in this Appendix&nbsp;D, all provisions of the Plan shall apply to Participants that are described in this Appendix&nbsp;D. </FONT></P>

</UL>
</UL>

<P><FONT SIZE=2><I>AMENDMENT NO. 4 TO THE CASH BALANCE PENSION PLAN</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>. </FONT></P>

<UL>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;I.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><I>Plan Expenses</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>. Section&nbsp;14.3 is amended by adding the following to the end of Section&nbsp;14.3: </FONT></P>

<UL>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>The
Administration Committee is authorized and directed to charge a distribution fee to each Participant who receives a lump sum distribution pursuant to Section&nbsp;7.2(b) of the Plan, to the
extent
permitted by law and related regulations. The Administration Committee is authorized and directed to pay this expense from the Trust and to allocate the expense to the Participant's Account. The
Administration Committee shall determine the amount of the distribution fee and may adjust the fee from time to time, at its discretion, provided that the fee must be reasonable with respect to the
services provided. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>II.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><I>Name Change.</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2> Effective January&nbsp;1, 2004, the official Plan name shall be the "WaMu Pension Plan." Accordingly, each reference in
the Plan document to the Washington Mutual,&nbsp;Inc. Cash Balance Pension Plan or the Cash Balance Pension Plan shall thereafter refer to the "WaMu Pension Plan." </FONT></P>

</UL>
</UL>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Pursuant
to the authority delegated to him by the Human Resources Committee of the Board of Directors at its June&nbsp;13, 2003 meeting, the undersigned officer of Washington
Mutual,&nbsp;Inc. hereby </FONT></P>

<P ALIGN="CENTER"><FONT SIZE=2>4</FONT></P>

<HR NOSHADE>
<!-- ZEQ.=4,SEQ=4,EFW="2129328",CP="WASHINGTON MUTUAL, INC",DN="8",CHK=162129,FOLIO='4',FILE='DISK018:[04SEA5.04SEA1035]KW1035A.;9',USER='VDESIO',CD=';6-MAR-2004;22:16' -->
<A NAME="page_kw1035_1_5"> </A>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>executes
this instrument to be effective as of October&nbsp;1, 2003 unless otherwise indicated in this instrument. </FONT></P>

<HTML>
<HEAD>

</HEAD>
<BODY BGCOLOR="#FFFFFF" LINK=BLUE  VLINK=PURPLE>
<BR>
<FONT SIZE=3 ><A HREF="#04SEA1034_9">QuickLinks</A></FONT>
<font size=3> -- Click here to rapidly navigate through this document</font>
<!-- TOC_END -->
<P ALIGN="RIGHT"><FONT SIZE=2><A
NAME="me1035_exhibit_10.7.9"> </A>
<A NAME="toc_me1035_1"> </A>
<BR></FONT><FONT SIZE=2><B>Exhibit 10.7.9    <BR>    </B></FONT></P>

<P ALIGN="RIGHT"><FONT SIZE=2>ATTACHMENT A </FONT></P>

<P ALIGN="CENTER"><FONT SIZE=2><B>WASHINGTON MUTUAL, INC. RETIREMENT SAVINGS AND INVESTMENT PLAN<BR>
MINIMUM DISTRIBUTION REQUIREMENTS AMENDMENT  </B></FONT></P>

<P ALIGN="CENTER"><FONT SIZE=2><B>AMENDMENT NO. 9  </B></FONT></P>

<P ALIGN="CENTER"><FONT SIZE=2><B>APPENDIX F  </B></FONT></P>

<P ALIGN="CENTER"><FONT SIZE=2><B>ARTICLE I<BR>
GENERAL RULES  </B></FONT></P>

<DL compact>
<DT style='margin-bottom:-11pt;'><FONT SIZE=2>1.1</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2><I>Effective Date.</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Unless an earlier effective date is specified in Section 6.1 of this Amendment, the provisions of this
Amendment will apply for purposes of determining required minimum distributions for calendar years beginning with the 2003 calendar year.
<BR><BR></FONT></DD><DT style='margin-bottom:-11pt;'><FONT SIZE=2>1.2</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2><I>Coordination with Minimum Distribution Requirements Previously in Effect.</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;If the effective date of this Amendment is
earlier than calendar years beginning with the 2003 calendar year, required minimum distributions for 2002 under this Amendment will be determined as follows. If the total amount of 2002 required
minimum distributions under the Plan made to the distributee prior to the effective date of this Amendment equals or exceeds the required minimum distributions determined under this Amendment, then no
additional distributions will be required to be made for 2002 on or after such date to the distributee. If the total amount of 2002 required minimum distributions under the Plan made to the
distributee prior to the effective date of this Amendment is less than the amount determined under this Amendment, then required minimum distributions for 2002 on and after such date will be
determined so that the total amount of required minimum distributions for 2002 made to the distributee will be the amount determined under this Amendment.
<BR><BR></FONT></DD><DT style='margin-bottom:-11pt;'><FONT SIZE=2>1.3</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2><I>Precedence.</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The requirements of this Amendment will take precedence over any inconsistent provisions of the Plan.
<BR><BR></FONT></DD><DT style='margin-bottom:-11pt;'><FONT SIZE=2>1.4</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2><I>Requirements of Treasury Regulations Incorporated.</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;All distributions required under this Amendment will be determined and
made in accordance with the Treasury regulations under Section 401(a)(9) of the Internal Revenue Code.
<BR><BR></FONT></DD><DT style='margin-bottom:-11pt;'><FONT SIZE=2>1.5</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2><I>TEFRA Section 242(b)(2) Elections.</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Notwithstanding the other provisions of this Amendment, distributions may be made under
a designation made before January 1, 1984, in accordance with Section 242(b)(2) of the Tax Equity and Fiscal Responsibility Act (TEFRA) and the provisions of the Plan that relate to Section 242(b)(2)
of TEFRA. </FONT></DD></DL>
<P ALIGN="CENTER"><FONT SIZE=2><A
NAME="me1035_article_ii_time_and_manner_of_distribution"> </A>
<A NAME="toc_me1035_2"> </A>
<BR></FONT><FONT SIZE=2><B>ARTICLE II<BR>  TIME AND MANNER OF DISTRIBUTION    <BR>    </B></FONT></P>

<DL compact>
<DT style='margin-bottom:-11pt;'><FONT SIZE=2>2.1</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2><I>Required Beginning Date.</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The Participant's entire interest will be distributed, or begin to be distributed, to the
Participant no later than the Participant's required beginning date.
<BR><BR></FONT></DD><DT style='margin-bottom:-11pt;'><FONT SIZE=2>2.2</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2><I>Death of Participant Before Distributions Begin.</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;If the Participant dies before distributions begin, the Participant's
entire interest will be distributed, or begin to be distributed, no later than as follows:
<BR><BR></FONT>
<DL compact>
<DT style='margin-bottom:-11pt;'><FONT SIZE=2>(a)</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2>If
the Participant's surviving spouse is the Participant's sole designated beneficiary, then, except as provided in Article VI of this Amendment, distributions to the surviving spouse
will begin by December 31 of the calendar year immediately following the calendar year in which </FONT></DD></DL>
</DD></DL>
<HR NOSHADE>
<!-- ZEQ.=1,SEQ=1,EFW="2129328",CP="WASHINGTON MUTUAL, INC",DN="9",CHK=847927,FOLIO='blank',FILE='DISK018:[04SEA5.04SEA1035]ME1035A.;8',USER='JKEENE',CD='11-MAR-2004;17:01' -->
<UL>
<UL>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>the
Participant died, or by December 31 of the calendar year in which the Participant would have attained age 70<SUP>1</SUP>/<SMALL>2</SMALL>, if later. </FONT></P>

</UL>
<DL compact>
<DT style='margin-bottom:-11pt;'><FONT SIZE=2>(b)</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2>If
the Participant's surviving spouse is not the Participant's sole designated beneficiary, then, except as provided in Article VI of this Amendment, distributions to the designated
beneficiary will begin by December 31 of the calendar year immediately following the calendar year in which the Participant died.
<BR><BR></FONT></DD><DT style='margin-bottom:-11pt;'><FONT SIZE=2>(c)</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2>If
there is no designated beneficiary as of September 30 of the year following the year of the Participant's death, the Participant's entire interest will be distributed by December
31 of the calendar year containing the fifth anniversary of the Participant's death.
<BR><BR></FONT></DD><DT style='margin-bottom:-11pt;'><FONT SIZE=2>(d)</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2>If
the Participant's surviving spouse is the Participant's sole designated beneficiary and the surviving spouse dies after the Participant but before distributions to the surviving
spouse begin, this Section 2.2, other than Section 2.2(a) of this Amendment, will apply as if the surviving spouse were the Participant. </FONT></DD></DL>


<P><FONT SIZE=2>For
purposes of this Section 2.2 and Article IV, unless Section 2.2(d) of this Amendment applies, distributions are considered to begin on the Participant's required beginning date. If Section 2.2(d)
of this Amendment applies, distributions are considered to begin on the date distributions are required to begin to the surviving spouse under Section 2.2(a) of this Amendment. If distributions under
an annuity purchased from an insurance company irrevocably commence to the Participant before the Participant's required beginning date (or to the Participant's surviving spouse before the date
distributions are required to begin to the surviving spouse under Section 2.2(a) of this Amendment), the date distributions are considered to begin is the date distributions actually commence. </FONT></P>

</UL>
<DL compact>
<DT style='margin-bottom:-11pt;'><FONT SIZE=2>2.3</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2><I>Forms of Distribution.</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Unless the Participant's interest is distributed in the form of an annuity purchased from an
insurance company or in a single sum on or before the required beginning date, as of the first distribution calendar year distributions will be made in accordance with Articles III and IV of this
Amendment. If the Participant's interest is distributed in the form of an annuity purchased from an insurance company, distributions thereunder will be made in accordance with the requirements of
Section 401(a)(9) of the Code and the Treasury regulations. </FONT></DD></DL>
<P ALIGN="CENTER"><FONT SIZE=2><A
NAME="me1035_article_iii_required_minimum_d__art02985"> </A>
<A NAME="toc_me1035_3"> </A>
<BR></FONT><FONT SIZE=2><B>ARTICLE III<BR>  REQUIRED MINIMUM DISTRIBUTIONS DURING PARTICIPANT'S LIFETIME    <BR>    </B></FONT></P>

<DL compact>
<DT style='margin-bottom:-11pt;'><FONT SIZE=2>3.1</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2><I>Amount of Required Minimum Distribution For Each Distribution Calendar Year.</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;During the Participant's lifetime, the
minimum amount that will be distributed for each distribution calendar year is the lesser of:
<BR><BR></FONT>
<DL compact>
<DT style='margin-bottom:-11pt;'><FONT SIZE=2>(a)</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2>the
quotient obtained by dividing the Participant's account balance by the distribution period in the Uniform Lifetime Table set forth in Section 1.401(a)(9)-9 of the Treasury
regulations, using the Participant's age as of the Participant's birthday in the distribution calendar year; or
<BR><BR></FONT></DD><DT style='margin-bottom:-11pt;'><FONT SIZE=2>(b)</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2>if
the Participant's sole designated beneficiary for the distribution calendar year is the Participant's spouse, the quotient obtained by dividing the Participant's account balance by
the number in the Joint and Last Survivor Table set forth in Section 1.401(a)(9)-9 of the Treasury regulations, using the Participant's and spouse's attained ages as of the Participant's and spouse's
birthdays in the distribution calendar year.
<BR><BR></FONT></DD></DL>
</DD><DT style='margin-bottom:-11pt;'><FONT SIZE=2>3.2</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2><I>Lifetime Required Minimum Distributions Continue Through Year of Participant's Death.</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Required minimum distributions will
be determined under this Article 3 beginning with the first distribution calendar year and up to and including the distribution calendar year that includes the Participant's date of death. </FONT></DD></DL>
<HR NOSHADE>
<!-- ZEQ.=2,SEQ=2,EFW="2129328",CP="WASHINGTON MUTUAL, INC",DN="9",CHK=598818,FOLIO='blank',FILE='DISK018:[04SEA5.04SEA1035]ME1035A.;8',USER='JKEENE',CD='11-MAR-2004;17:01' -->
<P ALIGN="CENTER"><FONT SIZE=2><A
NAME="me1035_article_iv_required_minimum_di__art02770"> </A>
<A NAME="toc_me1035_4"> </A>
<BR></FONT><FONT SIZE=2><B>ARTICLE IV<BR>  REQUIRED MINIMUM DISTRIBUTIONS AFTER PARTICIPANT'S DEATH    <BR>    </B></FONT></P>

<DL compact>
<DT style='margin-bottom:-11pt;'><FONT SIZE=2>4.1</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2><I>Death On or After Date Distributions Begin.</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>
<BR><BR></FONT>
<DL compact>
<DT style='margin-bottom:-11pt;'><FONT SIZE=2>(a)</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2><I>Participant Survived by Designated Beneficiary.</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;If the Participant dies on or after the date distributions begin and there
is a designated beneficiary, the minimum amount that will be distributed for each distribution calendar year after the year of the Participant's death is the quotient obtained by dividing the
Participant's account balance by the longer of the remaining life expectancy of the Participant or the remaining life expectancy of the Participant's designated beneficiary, determined as follows:
<BR><BR></FONT>
<DL compact>
<DT style='margin-bottom:-11pt;'><FONT SIZE=2>(1)</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2>The
Participant's remaining life expectancy is calculated using the age of the Participant in the year of death, reduced by one for each subsequent year.
<BR><BR></FONT></DD><DT style='margin-bottom:-11pt;'><FONT SIZE=2>(2)</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2>If
the Participant's surviving spouse is the Participant's sole designated beneficiary, the remaining life expectancy of the surviving spouse is calculated for each distribution
calendar year after the year of the Participant's death using the surviving spouse's age as of the spouse's birthday in that year. For distribution calendar years after the year of the surviving
spouse's death, the remaining life expectancy of the surviving spouse is calculated using the age of the surviving spouse as of the spouse's birthday in the calendar year of the spouse's death,
reduced by one for each subsequent calendar year.
<BR><BR></FONT></DD><DT style='margin-bottom:-11pt;'><FONT SIZE=2>(3)</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2>If
the Participant's surviving spouse is not the Participant's sole designated beneficiary, the designated beneficiary's remaining life expectancy is calculated using the age of the
beneficiary in the year following the year of the Participant's death, reduced by one for each subsequent year.
<BR><BR></FONT></DD></DL>
</DD><DT style='margin-bottom:-11pt;'><FONT SIZE=2>(b)</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2><I>No Designated Beneficiary.</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;If the Participant dies on or after the date distributions begin and there is no designated
beneficiary as of September 30 of the year after the year of the Participant's death, the minimum amount that will be distributed for each distribution calendar year after the year of the
Participant's death is the quotient obtained by dividing the Participant's account balance by the Participant's remaining life expectancy calculated using the age of the Participant in the year of
death, reduced by one for each subsequent year.
<BR><BR></FONT></DD></DL>
</DD><DT style='margin-bottom:-11pt;'><FONT SIZE=2>4.2</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2><I>Death Before Date Distributions Begin.</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>
<BR><BR></FONT>
<DL compact>
<DT style='margin-bottom:-11pt;'><FONT SIZE=2>(a)</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2><I>Participant Survived by Designated Beneficiary.</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Except as provided in Article VI of this Amendment, if the Participant
dies before the date distributions begin and there is a designated beneficiary, the minimum amount that will be distributed for each distribution calendar year after the year of the Participant's
death is the quotient obtained by dividing the Participant's account balance by the remaining life expectancy of the Participant's designated beneficiary, determined as provided in Section 4.1 of this
Amendment.
<BR><BR></FONT></DD><DT style='margin-bottom:-11pt;'><FONT SIZE=2>(b)</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2><I>No Designated Beneficiary.</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;If the Participant dies before the date distributions begin and there is no designated
beneficiary as of September 30 of the year following the year of the Participant's death, distribution of the Participant's entire interest will be completed by December 31 of the calendar year
containing the fifth anniversary of the Participant's death.
<BR><BR></FONT></DD><DT style='margin-bottom:-11pt;'><FONT SIZE=2>(c)</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2><I>Death of Surviving Spouse Before Distributions to Surviving Spouse Are Required to Begin.</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;If the Participant dies before
the date distributions begin, the Participant's surviving spouse is the Participant's sole designated beneficiary, and the surviving spouse dies before distributions are required to begin to the
surviving spouse under Section 2.2(a) of this Amendment, this Section 4.2 will apply as if the surviving spouse were the Participant. </FONT></DD></DL>
</DD></DL>
<HR NOSHADE>
<!-- ZEQ.=3,SEQ=3,EFW="2129328",CP="WASHINGTON MUTUAL, INC",DN="9",CHK=762210,FOLIO='blank',FILE='DISK018:[04SEA5.04SEA1035]ME1035A.;8',USER='JKEENE',CD='11-MAR-2004;17:01' -->
<UL>
<UL>
</UL>
</UL>
<P ALIGN="CENTER"><FONT SIZE=2><A
NAME="me1035_article_v_definitions"> </A>
<A NAME="toc_me1035_5"> </A>
<BR></FONT><FONT SIZE=2><B>ARTICLE V<BR>  DEFINITIONS    <BR>    </B></FONT></P>

<DL compact>
<DT style='margin-bottom:-11pt;'><FONT SIZE=2>5.1</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2><I>Designated beneficiary.</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The individual who is designated as the Beneficiary under the Plan and is the designated
beneficiary under Section 401(a)(9) of the Internal Revenue Code and Section 1.401(a)(9)-1, Q&amp;A-4, of the Treasury regulations.
<BR><BR></FONT></DD><DT style='margin-bottom:-11pt;'><FONT SIZE=2>5.2</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2><I>Distribution calendar year.</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;A calendar year for which a minimum distribution is required. For distributions beginning
before the Participant's death, the first distribution calendar year is the calendar year immediately preceding the calendar year which contains the Participant's required beginning date. For
distributions beginning after the Participant's death, the first distribution calendar year is the calendar year in which distributions are required to begin under Section 2.2 of this Amendment. The
required minimum distribution for the Participant's first distribution calendar year will be made on or before the Participant's required beginning date. The required minimum distribution for other
distribution calendar years, including the required minimum distribution for the distribution calendar year in which the Participant's required beginning date occurs, will be made on or before
December 31 of that distribution calendar year.
<BR><BR></FONT></DD><DT style='margin-bottom:-11pt;'><FONT SIZE=2>5.3</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2><I>Life expectancy.</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Life expectancy as computed by use of the Single Life Table in Section 1.401(a)(9)-9 of the Treasury
regulations.
<BR><BR></FONT></DD><DT style='margin-bottom:-11pt;'><FONT SIZE=2>5.4</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2><I>Participant's account balance.</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The account balance as of the last valuation date in the calendar year immediately
preceding the distribution calendar year (valuation calendar year) increased by the amount of any contributions made and allocated or forfeitures allocated to the account balance as of dates in the
valuation calendar year after the valuation date and decreased by distributions made in the valuation calendar year after the valuation date. The account balance for the valuation calendar year
includes any amounts rolled over or transferred to the Plan either in the valuation calendar year or in the distribution calendar year if distributed or transferred in the valuation calendar year.
<BR><BR></FONT></DD><DT style='margin-bottom:-11pt;'><FONT SIZE=2>5.5</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2><I>Required beginning date.</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The date specified in the Plan when distributions under Section 401(a)(9) of the Internal Revenue
Code are required to begin. </FONT></DD></DL>
<P ALIGN="CENTER"><FONT SIZE=2><A
NAME="me1035_article_vi_adoption_agreement_elections"> </A>
<A NAME="toc_me1035_6"> </A>
<BR></FONT><FONT SIZE=2><B>ARTICLE VI<BR>  ADOPTION AGREEMENT ELECTIONS    <BR>    </B></FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2><B>The questions in this Article VI only need to be completed in order to override the default provisions set forth below. If all of the default provisions will apply, then these
questions should be skipped.  </B></FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>Unless the employer elects otherwise in this Article VI, the following defaults apply: </FONT></P>

<UL>
<DL compact>
<DT style='margin-bottom:-11pt;'><FONT SIZE=2>1)</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2>The
minimum distribution requirements are effective for distribution calendar years beginning with the 2003 calendar year unless an earlier date is specified in Section 6.1 of this
Amendment.
<BR><BR></FONT></DD><DT style='margin-bottom:-11pt;'><FONT SIZE=2>2)</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2>Participants
or beneficiaries may elect on an individual basis whether the 5-year rule or the life expectancy rule in the Plan applies to distributions after the death of a Participant
who has a designated beneficiary.
<BR><BR></FONT></DD></DL>
</UL>
<DL compact>
<DT style='margin-bottom:-11pt;'><FONT SIZE=2>6.1</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2><B>Effective Date of Plan Amendment for Section 401(a)(9) Final and Temporary Treasury Regulations.</B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>
<BR><BR></FONT>
<DL compact>
<DT style='margin-bottom:-11pt;'><FONT SIZE=2>(</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2>)&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;This
 Amendment applies for purposes of determining required minimum distributions for distribution calendar years beginning with the 2003 calendar year, as well as required minimum
distributions for the 2002 distribution calendar year that are made on or after
<U>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</U> (leave blank if this Amendment does not apply to any minimum distributions
for the 2002 distribution calendar year). </FONT></DD></DL>
</DD></DL>
<HR NOSHADE>
<!-- ZEQ.=4,SEQ=4,EFW="2129328",CP="WASHINGTON MUTUAL, INC",DN="9",CHK=48316,FOLIO='blank',FILE='DISK018:[04SEA5.04SEA1035]ME1035A.;8',USER='JKEENE',CD='11-MAR-2004;17:01' -->
<UL>
<UL>
</UL>
</UL>
<DL compact>
<DT style='margin-bottom:-11pt;'><FONT SIZE=2>6.2</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2><B>Election to not permit Participants or Beneficiaries to Elect 5-Year Rule.</B></FONT></DD></DL>
<UL>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>Unless
elected below, Participants or beneficiaries may elect on an individual basis whether the 5-year rule or the life expectancy rule in Sections 2.2 and 4.2 of this Amendment applies to
distributions after the death of a Participant who has a designated beneficiary. The election must be made no later than the earlier of September 30 of the calendar year in which distribution would be
required to begin under Section 2.2 of this Amendment, or by September 30 of the calendar year which contains the fifth anniversary of the Participant's (or, if applicable, surviving spouse's) death.
If neither the Participant nor beneficiary makes an election under this paragraph, distributions will be made in accordance with
Sections 2.2 and 4.2 of this Amendment and, if applicable, the elections in Section 6.3 of this Amendment below. </FONT></P>

<DL compact>
<DT style='margin-bottom:-11pt;'><FONT SIZE=2>(</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2>)&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The
 provision set forth above in this Section 6.2 shall not apply. Rather, Sections 2.2 and 4.2 of this Amendment shall apply except as elected in Section 6.3 of this Amendment below.
<BR><BR></FONT></DD></DL>
</UL>
<DL compact>
<DT style='margin-bottom:-11pt;'><FONT SIZE=2>6.3</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2><B>Election to Apply 5-Year Rule to Distributions to Designated Beneficiaries.</B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>
<BR><BR></FONT>
<DL compact>
<DT style='margin-bottom:-11pt;'><FONT SIZE=2>(</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2>)&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;If
 the Participant dies before distributions begin and there is a designated beneficiary, distribution to the designated beneficiary is not required to begin by the date specified in
the Plan, but the Participant's entire interest will be distributed to the designated beneficiary by December 31 of the calendar year containing the fifth anniversary of the Participant's death. If
the Participant's surviving spouse is the Participant's sole designated beneficiary and the surviving spouse dies after the Participant but before distributions to either the Participant or the
surviving spouse begin, this election will apply as if the surviving spouse were the Participant. </FONT></DD></DL>
</DD></DL>
<UL>
<UL>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>If
the above is elected, then this election will apply to: </FONT></P>

<DL compact>
<DT style='margin-bottom:-11pt;'><FONT SIZE=2>(</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2>)&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;All
 distributions.
<BR><BR></FONT></DD><DT style='margin-bottom:-11pt;'><FONT SIZE=2>(</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2>)&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The
 following
 distributions:<U>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
 &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</U>.
<BR><BR></FONT></DD></DL>
</UL>
</UL>
<DL compact>
<DT style='margin-bottom:-11pt;'><FONT SIZE=2>6.4</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2><B>Election to Allow Designated Beneficiary Receiving Distributions Under 5-Year Rule to Elect Life Expectancy Distributions.</B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>
<BR><BR></FONT>
<DL compact>
<DT style='margin-bottom:-11pt;'><FONT SIZE=2>(</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2>)&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;A
 designated beneficiary who is receiving payments under the 5-year rule may make a new election to receive payments under the life expectancy rule until December 31, 2003, provided
that all amounts that would have been required to be distributed under the life expectancy rule for all distribution calendar years before 2004 are distributed by the earlier of December 31, 2003 or
the end of the 5-year period. </FONT></DD></DL>
</DD></DL>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>This
amendment has been adopted and executed this 23rd day of December, 2003. </FONT></P>

<P ALIGN="CENTER"><FONT SIZE=2><A
NAME="ky1035_amendment_no._1_to_the_washing__ame04972"> </A>
<A NAME="toc_ky1035_1"> </A>
<BR></FONT><FONT SIZE=2><B>AMENDMENT NO. 1<BR>  TO THE WASHINGTON MUTUAL,&nbsp;INC. DEFERRED COMPENSATION PLAN FOR DIRECTORS AND CERTAIN HIGHLY COMPENSATED EMPLOYEES    <BR>    </B></FONT></P>

<DL compact>
<DT style='margin-bottom:-11pt;'><FONT SIZE=2>1.</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2>Section&nbsp;1.6
is amended by adding the following sentence to the end of Section&nbsp;1.6: </FONT></DD></DL>
<UL>
<UL>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>Compensation
shall include payments from any deferred bonus or incentive plan to the extent that the Plan Administration Committee has authorized the deferral of such payments under
Section&nbsp;2.2. </FONT></P>

</UL>
</UL>
<DL compact>
<DT style='margin-bottom:-11pt;'><FONT SIZE=2>2.</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2>Section&nbsp;2.2
is amended by replacing Section&nbsp;2.2(c) with the following: </FONT></DD></DL>
<UL>
<UL>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>(c)&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Each
Eligible Employee may also elect to defer a certain percentage amount, up to 100%, of any payment to which Eligible Employee is entitled under the Washington Mutual
Advisors,&nbsp;Inc. Executive Deferred Compensation Award Plan ("Washington Mutual Advisors D.C. Plan") and the Washington Mutual Incentive Plan for Certain Loan Consultants. </FONT></P>

</UL>
</UL>

<DOCUMENT>
<TYPE>EX-10.12
<SEQUENCE>12
<FILENAME>a2129328zex-10_12.htm
<DESCRIPTION>EXHIBIT 10.12
<TEXT>
<HTML>
<HEAD>

</HEAD>
<BODY BGCOLOR="#FFFFFF" LINK=BLUE  VLINK=PURPLE>
<BR>
<FONT SIZE=3 ><A HREF="#04SEA1034_11">QuickLinks</A></FONT>

<P ALIGN="RIGHT"><FONT SIZE=2><A
NAME="page_kz1035_1_1"> </A> </FONT></P>

<!-- TOC_END -->
<P ALIGN="RIGHT"><FONT SIZE=2><A
NAME="kz1035_exhibit_10.12"> </A>
<A NAME="toc_kz1035_1"> </A>
<BR></FONT><FONT SIZE=2><B>Exhibit&nbsp;10.12    <BR>    </B></FONT></P>

<!-- User-specified TAGGED TABLE -->
<TABLE WIDTH="100%" BORDER=0 CELLSPACING=0 CELLPADDING=0>
<TR VALIGN="BOTTOM">
<TH WIDTH="70%" ALIGN="CENTER"><FONT SIZE=1>&nbsp;</FONT><BR></TH>
<TH WIDTH="3%"><FONT SIZE=1>&nbsp;</FONT></TH>
<TH WIDTH="28%" ALIGN="LEFT"><FONT SIZE=1>&nbsp;</FONT><BR></TH>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD WIDTH="70%"><FONT SIZE=2><B>
<IMG SRC="g808293.jpg" ALT="LOGO" WIDTH="258" HEIGHT="61">
</B></FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="3%"><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="28%" ALIGN="RIGHT" VALIGN="BOTTOM"><FONT SIZE=2><B>2003 Leadership Bonus Plan</B></FONT></TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD COLSPAN=3><HR NOSHADE></TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<!-- end of user-specified TAGGED TABLE -->


<P><FONT SIZE=2><B>PLAN OVERVIEW  </B></FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>Washington
Mutual's Leadership Bonus Plan provides eligible employees in Levels 1-8 the opportunity to earn an annual cash bonus based on performance. Target bonuses are set as a
percentage of Earned Salary and vary by Level and job. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>The
plan year and performance measurement period is from January&nbsp;1 through December&nbsp;31. Washington Mutual must achieve a Return on Common Equity of at least 15% for </FONT> <FONT SIZE=2><I>any</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2> payouts to
occur. No award under this plan is earned or paid until approved by Washington Mutual's Board of Directors. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2><B>PEFORMANCE METRICS AND WEIGHTS  </B></FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>The
plan measures and rewards performance against established company-wide and individual performance metrics. In 2003, company performance is determined based on three metrics-corporate
Earnings per Share (EPS), Compliance Index, and Customer Satisfaction Index. Customer Satisfaction is assessed based on internal and/or external customer surveys and is measured at the corporate,
business segment, or department level, depending on Executive Committee member measurement strategies. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>Each
participant's target bonus is weighted as shown in the table below. Actual payouts may range from 0-150% of the target for each component. </FONT></P>

<P ALIGN="CENTER"><FONT SIZE=2><B>Performance Metrics and weights by Level<BR>
Company-wide Performance Metrics  </B></FONT></P>

<!-- User-specified TAGGED TABLE -->
<TABLE WIDTH="100%" BORDER=0 CELLSPACING=0 CELLPADDING=0>
<TR VALIGN="BOTTOM">
<TH WIDTH="11%" ALIGN="LEFT"><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;</FONT><BR></TH>
<TH WIDTH="8%"><FONT SIZE=1>&nbsp;</FONT></TH>
<TH COLSPAN=7 ALIGN="CENTER"><FONT SIZE=1>&nbsp;</FONT><BR></TH>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="BOTTOM">
<TH WIDTH="11%" ALIGN="CENTER"><FONT SIZE=1><B>Level</B></FONT><HR NOSHADE></TH>
<TH WIDTH="8%"><FONT SIZE=1>&nbsp;</FONT></TH>
<TH WIDTH="10%" ALIGN="CENTER"><FONT SIZE=1><B>Earnings<BR>
Per Share</B></FONT><HR NOSHADE></TH>
<TH WIDTH="8%"><FONT SIZE=1>&nbsp;</FONT></TH>
<TH WIDTH="11%" ALIGN="CENTER"><FONT SIZE=1><B>Compliance Index</B></FONT><HR NOSHADE></TH>
<TH WIDTH="8%"><FONT SIZE=1>&nbsp;</FONT></TH>
<TH WIDTH="22%" ALIGN="CENTER"><FONT SIZE=1><B>Customer<BR>
Satisfaction</B></FONT><HR NOSHADE></TH>
<TH WIDTH="8%"><FONT SIZE=1>&nbsp;</FONT></TH>
<TH WIDTH="13%" ALIGN="CENTER"><FONT SIZE=1><B>Individual<BR>
Performance</B></FONT><HR NOSHADE></TH>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD WIDTH="11%" ALIGN="CENTER" VALIGN="CENTER"><FONT SIZE=2><B>Executive<BR>
Committee</B></FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="8%" VALIGN="CENTER"><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="10%" ALIGN="CENTER" VALIGN="CENTER"><FONT SIZE=2>70%</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="8%" VALIGN="CENTER"><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="11%" ALIGN="CENTER" VALIGN="CENTER"><FONT SIZE=2>15%</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="8%" VALIGN="CENTER"><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="22%" ALIGN="CENTER"><FONT SIZE=2>15%<BR>
(Corporate)</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="8%"><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="13%" ALIGN="CENTER" VALIGN="CENTER"><FONT SIZE=2>0%</FONT></TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD WIDTH="11%" ALIGN="CENTER" VALIGN="CENTER"><BR><FONT SIZE=2><B>4-5</B></FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="8%" VALIGN="CENTER"><FONT SIZE=2><BR>&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="10%" ALIGN="CENTER" VALIGN="CENTER"><FONT SIZE=2><BR>
40%</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="8%" VALIGN="CENTER"><FONT SIZE=2><BR>&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="11%" ALIGN="CENTER" VALIGN="CENTER"><FONT SIZE=2><BR>
15%</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="8%" VALIGN="CENTER"><FONT SIZE=2><BR>&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="22%" ALIGN="CENTER"><FONT SIZE=2><BR>
15%<BR>
(Segment or Department)</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="8%"><FONT SIZE=2><BR>&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="13%" ALIGN="CENTER" VALIGN="CENTER"><FONT SIZE=2><BR>
30%</FONT></TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD WIDTH="11%" ALIGN="CENTER" VALIGN="CENTER"><BR><FONT SIZE=2><B>6-8</B></FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="8%" VALIGN="CENTER"><FONT SIZE=2><BR>&nbsp;</FONT></TD>

<P ALIGN="CENTER"><FONT SIZE=2>1</FONT></P>

<A NAME="page_kz1035_1_2"> </A>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>For
example, a Level 7 target bonus of $10,000 would be divided according to column (A)&nbsp;below; a payout example in columns (B)&nbsp;and (C)&nbsp;is also included. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2><B>COMPANY-WIDE PERFORMANCE TARGETS  </B></FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>Washington
Mutual's Board of Directors established the following performance targets for 2003 company-wide metrics. </FONT></P>


<P><FONT SIZE=2><B>Earnings per Share  </B></FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>The
Earnings per Share (EPS) metric is defined as net income divided by average number of common shares outstanding as publicly reported. The 2003 performance standards and payout range for this
measure is: </FONT></P>

<DL compact>
<DT style='margin-bottom:-11pt;'><FONT SIZE=2>*</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2>The
EPS target will be held constant as long as the average of the federal funds interest rate is &plusmn;50 basis points from that assumed in the 2003
financial plan. The positive or negative impacts of interest rate changes outside of this range may result in an adjustment in the EPS target. The Director's Human Resource Committee must approve any
adjustments in targets. </FONT></DD></DL>
<P ALIGN="CENTER"><FONT SIZE=2>2</FONT></P>

<HR NOSHADE>
<!-- ZEQ.=2,SEQ=2,EFW="2129328",CP="WASHINGTON MUTUAL, INC",DN="11",CHK=808837,FOLIO='2',FILE='DISK018:[04SEA5.04SEA1035]KZ1035A.;9',USER='JKEENE',CD='11-MAR-2004;17:01' -->
<A NAME="page_kz1035_1_3"> </A>

<P><FONT SIZE=2><B>Compliance Index  </B></FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>The
Compliance Index is composed of three compliance-related goals and measures. The overall payout will equal the arithmetic average of the percent payouts for the three measures. However, no payout
will be made if the overall average falls below 75&nbsp;percent. </FONT></P>

<!-- User-specified TAGGED TABLE -->
<TABLE WIDTH="100%" BORDER=0 CELLSPACING=0 CELLPADDING=0>

&nbsp;</FONT></TD>

<TD WIDTH="9%"><FONT SIZE=2><BR>
3-</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="2%"><FONT SIZE=2><BR>&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="11%" ALIGN="CENTER"><FONT SIZE=2><BR>
0</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="2%"><FONT SIZE=2><BR>&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="37%"><FONT SIZE=2><BR>
Rating denotes performance has deteriorated.</FONT></TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD COLSPAN=5 ALIGN="RIGHT"><BR><FONT SIZE=2><B>Overall Payout Equals:</B></FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="2%"><FONT SIZE=2><B><BR>&nbsp;</B></FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="11%" ALIGN="CENTER"><FONT SIZE=2><B><BR>
Average of<BR>
three scores<BR>
above</B></FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="2%"><FONT SIZE=2><B><BR>&nbsp;</B></FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="37%"><FONT SIZE=2><B><BR>
&nbsp;</B></FONT></TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<!-- end of user-specified TAGGED TABLE -->

<P ALIGN="CENTER"><FONT SIZE=2>3</FONT></P>

<HR NOSHADE>
<!-- ZEQ.=3,SEQ=3,EFW="2129328",CP="WASHINGTON MUTUAL, INC",DN="11",CHK=4450,FOLIO='3',FILE='DISK018:[04SEA5.04SEA1035]KZ1035A.;9',USER='JKEENE',CD='11-MAR-2004;17:01' -->
<A NAME="page_kz1035_1_4"> </A>

<P><FONT SIZE=2><B>Customer Satisfaction Index  </B></FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>The
Customer Satisfaction Index is composed of internal and/or external customer satisfaction survey results. The Quality Services Management team will work with Executive Committee members to
determine for their areas: </FONT></P>

<DL compact>
<DT style='margin-bottom:-11pt;'><FONT SIZE=2>&#149;</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2><B>Where customer satisfaction is measured</B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>, either at the business segment level or department level, and
<BR><BR></FONT></DD><DT style='margin-bottom:-11pt;'><FONT SIZE=2>&#149;</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2><B>Weighting</B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2> between internal customer satisfaction and external customer satisfaction. This may vary by business segment. </FONT></DD></DL>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>For
2003, the scale for measuring external survey results will be changed to mirror the internal survey scoring scale, as shown below: </FONT></P>

<P ALIGN="CENTER"><FONT SIZE=2><B>COMBINED INTERNAL &amp; EXTERNAL SURVEY RESULTS<BR>
(the weighting between internal and external results may vary by business segment)  </B></FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>The
Quality Services Management team collects and compiles all customer satisfaction survey results during the plan year. The QSM team calculates the final scores, weightings, and payout percentages
in January for the prior year. Survey scores are rounded to the nearest tenth. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2><B>Individual Performance  </B></FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>Payouts
for individual performance are based on an evaluation by the participant's manager. In determining a performance rating, managers should consider </FONT> <FONT SIZE=2><B><I>what</I></B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2> is actually achieved (results) in
addition to </FONT><FONT SIZE=2><B><I>how</I></B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2> results are achieved (leadership competencies). Performance goals should be set early in the year through a collaborative process
between the participant and manager. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2><B><I>2003 Compliance Requirements  </I></B></FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>In
2003, participants with material impact on compliance results must have at least 25% of individual performance goals devoted to compliance related measures, tailored to fit the manager's job
responsibilities. Copies of compliance goals should be forwarded to the division Business Unit Compliance Officer. More information about setting compliance goals may be found at the following link:
http://home.wamu.net/corpHR/GoalSettingGuide.jsp. </FONT></P>

<P ALIGN="CENTER"><FONT SIZE=2>4</FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2><B>OTHER PLAN DETAILS  </B></FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2><I>Eligibility</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&#151;Employees as of December&nbsp;31 of the plan year in jobs assigned to Levels 1-8 before October&nbsp;1 of the plan year who
do not participate in other cash incentive or bonus plans are eligible. Contract staff and temporary employees are not eligible for this plan. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2><I>Earned Salary</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&#151;Earned Salary is the base salary actually received while eligible for the plan during the plan year. Earned Salary includes
sick and vacation pay, but excludes allowances, disability pay, relocation, performance bonuses, sign-on bonuses, overrides, commissions,
draws, or any other type of non-salary compensation. Earned Salary is used for the calculation of target awards, which are calculated by multiplying Earned Salary by target bonus percent. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2><I>New Hires</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&#151;New employees may earn a bonus award based on their Earned Salary from date of hire as documented by Human Resources. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2><I>Mid-Year Job Changes</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&#151;Employees newly meeting eligibility requirements mid-plan year may earn a bonus award based on
Earned Salary from the date of the Human Resources documented job change. </FONT></P>

<P ALIGN="CENTER"><FONT SIZE=2>5</FONT></P>

<HR NOSHADE>
<!-- ZEQ.=5,SEQ=5,EFW="2129328",CP="WASHINGTON MUTUAL, INC",DN="11",CHK=661911,FOLIO='5',FILE='DISK018:[04SEA5.04SEA1035]KZ1035A.;9',USER='JKEENE',CD='11-MAR-2004;17:01' -->
<A NAME="page_kz1035_1_6"> </A>
<BR>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>Participants
transferring to a position that is eligible for a different cash incentive or bonus plan during the plan year lose eligibility for this plan and may earn a bonus award based on Earned
Salary up to the last day of eligibility. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2><I>Temporary Leave of Absence</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&#151;Employees on a leave of absence may earn a bonus award based on their Earned Salary during the plan year. Awards
are paid as designated below. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2><I>Prorated Target Bonus</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&#151;Employees who have job or status changes during the plan year that impact their target bonus percent will have their
target bonus amounts based on their business days in position according to the effective date of the Human Resources approved and documented change. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2><I>Separation</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&#151;Employees who: </FONT></P>

<UL>
<DL compact>
<DT style='margin-bottom:-11pt;'><FONT SIZE=2>&#149;</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2><I>Voluntarily separate</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2> prior to the end of the plan year are not eligible for a payout.
<BR><BR></FONT></DD><DT style='margin-bottom:-11pt;'><FONT SIZE=2>&#149;</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2><I>Voluntarily separate</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2> after the end of the plan year are eligible for a payout under the normal terms and conditions of this
plan. Awards are paid as designated below.
<BR><BR></FONT></DD><DT style='margin-bottom:-11pt;'><FONT SIZE=2>&#149;</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2><I>Involuntarily separate prior to the end of the plan year for performance or other reasons not specified below</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2> are not
eligible for a payout.
<BR><BR></FONT></DD><DT style='margin-bottom:-11pt;'><FONT SIZE=2>&#149;</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2><I>Separate prior to the end of the plan year as a result of a reduction in work force</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2> are eligible to earn an award based on
Earned Salary through the effective date of separation. At the discretion of the Company, special provisions for a workforce reduction may wholly or partly supercede this provision.
<BR><BR></FONT></DD><DT style='margin-bottom:-11pt;'><FONT SIZE=2>&#149;</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2><I>Separate prior to the end of the plan year due to death, permanent disability, or approved retirement</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2> are eligible to earn an
award based on Earned Salary up to the last day of active employment. Awards are paid as designated below. </FONT></DD></DL>
</UL>

<P><FONT SIZE=2><I>Performance Requirements&#151;</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>Bonuses are awarded at the discretion of Management and the Board of Directors. As such, employees with performance
problems (as determined by their Manager), including but not limited to those rated "At Risk" or "Needs Development," or who engage in conduct that violates Washington Mutual's Code of Conduct, may be
determined by Management to be ineligible for all or part of any potential bonus. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2><I>Payouts&#151;</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>Awards under this plan are earned on the date the Board approves the payouts and are targeted to be paid in the last paycheck in
January following the plan year. Participants have no right or entitlement to bonuses until the amounts are earned on the Board's approval date. Plan payments are subject to all applicable taxes and
withholdings in the year paid. </FONT></P>


<P><FONT SIZE=2><I>Deferral&#151;</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>Participants eligible for the Washington Mutual Deferred Compensation Plan may defer some or all of any bonus payout subject to the
provisions of that plan. Contact the Employee Service Center and request Stock Administration for enrollment information. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2><I>At-Will Employment&#151;</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>Nothing in the Plan is intended to modify participants' at-will employment status. Employment at
Washington Mutual is subject to the mutual consent of each employee and Washington Mutual, and either party may terminate employment at any time, for any reason, without cause or prior notice. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2><I>Not A Contract&#151;</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>The terms and provisions of this bonus plan are not intended to be a contract, are not contractually enforceable, and are not
intended to promise specific treatment in specific circumstances. Rather, they are guidelines that Washington Mutual reserves the right to amend or terminate without prior notice, and to apply and
interpret within its sole discretion. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2><I>Equal Employment Opportunity&#151;</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>This plan is administered and bonus compensation paid on an equal opportunity basis without regard to race,
religion, sex, age, national origin, physical or mental disability, marital status, sexual orientation, or any other characteristic that is protected by applicable law. </FONT></P>

<P ALIGN="CENTER"><FONT SIZE=2>6</FONT></P>

<HR NOSHADE>
<!-- ZEQ.=6,SEQ=6,EFW="2129328",CP="WASHINGTON MUTUAL, INC",DN="11",CHK=280347,FOLIO='6',FILE='DISK018:[04SEA5.04SEA1035]KZ1035A.;9',USER='JKEENE',CD='11-MAR-2004;17:01' -->
<A NAME="page_kz1035_1_7"> </A>
<BR>

<P><FONT SIZE=2><I>Prohibition against Commissions</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&#151;It is Washington Mutual policy that no officer or employee who has or exercises final authority with respect
to any loan or investment shall receive any commission on such loan or investment. "Commission" is defined as compensation that varies in amount proportionately to the amount of such loan or
investment. The purpose of this policy is to avoid creating incentives for such decision-makers to offer or approve imprudently large loans or investments. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2><I>Acknowledgement of Terms and Conditions&#151;</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>By participating in and accepting compensation under this plan, participants agree that if a dispute
arises concerning the application or interpretation of the plan or any compensation paid under the plan, and if the dispute results in litigation or arbitration, the substantially prevailing party in
any such arbitration or litigation shall be entitled to recover reasonable attorney's fees and costs. </FONT></P>

<P ALIGN="CENTER"><FONT SIZE=2>7</FONT></P>

<HR NOSHADE>

<P ALIGN="CENTER"><FONT SIZE=2><A
NAME="la1035_amendment_no._1_to_the_february_2001_wamu_plan"> </A>
<A NAME="toc_la1035_1"> </A>
<BR></FONT><FONT SIZE=2><B>AMENDMENT NO. 1<BR>  TO THE FEBRUARY 2001 WAMU PLAN    <BR>    </B></FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;1.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Section&nbsp;1.8
of the February&nbsp;2001 WaMu Shares Plan is hereby amended by adding the following sentence to the end of that section: </FONT></P>

<UL>
<UL>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>Effective
for grants made under this Plan after February&nbsp;12, 2001, the term "Employee" shall not include any Employee who is designated by the Company or an affiliate as "Level 1" through
"Level 8", inclusive. </FONT></P>

</UL>
</UL>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;2.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Section&nbsp;4.6
is hereby amended by replacing the word "Board" with the word "Committee." </FONT></P>

<FONT SIZE=3 ><A HREF="#04SEA1034_13">QuickLinks</A></FONT>

<P ALIGN="RIGHT"><FONT SIZE=2><B>Exhibit 10.44.2  </B></FONT></P>

<P ALIGN="CENTER"><FONT SIZE=2><A
NAME="lc1035_amendment_no._3_to_the_february_2001_wamu_shares_plan"> </A>
<A NAME="toc_lc1035_1"> </A>
<BR></FONT><FONT SIZE=2><B>AMENDMENT NO. 3<BR>  TO THE FEBRUARY 2001 WAMU SHARES PLAN    <BR>    </B></FONT></P>


<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;On July&nbsp;16, 2002, the Board of Directors of Washington Mutual,&nbsp;Inc. ("Company") approved an additional grant of options to purchase 4,497,900 shares
under the Plan and amended the February&nbsp;2001 WaMu Shares Plan ("Plan"). Whereas the minutes of the Board meeting reflect the Board's intent to authorize an additional 4,497,900 shares of stock
under the Plan, the following amendment to the Plan is necessary to carry out that intent and is hereby adopted: </FONT></P>

<UL>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>Section&nbsp;5.2
of the February&nbsp;2001 WaMu Shares Plan is hereby amended by increasing the maximum aggregate number of shares of Stock that may be issued from 3,300,000 to 7,797,900. </FONT></P>

</UL>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;IN
WITNESS WHEREOF, Washington Mutual,&nbsp;Inc., acting through the undersigned authorized representative, has executed this Amendment effective as of the 16<SUP>th</SUP> day of
July, 2002. </FONT></P>
